result.execSummary:
The defendant Caprice D Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Caprice D Price is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Caprice D Price was found guilty of Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine of $50.00 plus all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit and balance by 6-30-18 or serve 10 days in the House of Correction.

Court will consider motion for expungement in 2 years if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served. Huber privileges for school and programming. Can have ES. Court stayed the commencement until 7-6-16.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caprice D Price

records.addlTxt: Copy of F&C Co to defendant and to Sheriff dept

Defendant Caprice D Price in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve six months in the Day Reporting Center, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for school and programing. Can have ES. Court stayed the commencment until 7-6-16.

Fine of $50.00 plus all mandatory  costs , fees and dna surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit and balance by 6-30-18 or serve 10 days in the House of Correction.  

Court will consider motion for expungement in 2 years if defendant successfully completes sentence and has no further violations of the law. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
COURT SET BAIL IN THE AMOUNT OF $50.00 CASH WHICH CAN BE POSTED OUT OF CUSTODY AT THE CLERK OF COURTS.

Defendant Caprice D Price in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OVER FROM 5-11-16  

AS TO COUNT ONE: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE, COURT ORDERED COUNT TWO:  DISMISSED AND READ IN . 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered case adjourned for status on  counsel  in Branch 47

Defendant Caprice D Price in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
